1.text: My son, if you will receive my words, and hide my commandments with you;

2.text: So that you incline your ear to wisdom, and apply your heart to understanding;

3.text: Yes, if you cry after knowledge, and lift up your voice for understanding;

4.text: If you seek her as silver, and search for her as for hid treasures;

5.text: Then shall you understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.

6.text: For the LORD gives wisdom: out of his mouth comes knowledge and understanding.

7.text: He lays up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

8.text: He keeps the paths of judgment, and preserves the way of his saints.

9.text: Then shall you understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yes, every good path.

10.text: When wisdom enters into your heart, and knowledge is pleasant to your soul;

11.text: Discretion shall preserve you, understanding shall keep you:

12.text: To deliver you from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaks fraudulent things;

13.text: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

14.text: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

15.text: Whose ways are crooked, and they fraudulent in their paths:

16.text: To deliver you from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flatters with her words;

17.text: Which forsakes the guide of her youth, and forgets the covenant of her God.

18.text: For her house inclines to death, and her paths to the dead.

19.text: None that go to her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

20.text: That you may walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

21.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

22.text: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
